company.name: Jawg
company.description: Disruptive Mapping & Geo-spatial solutions made in France

description.label: Platform lead Architect & Developer
description.details:
Project **mapsquare** lead to the creation of our company, **Jawg Maps**. I was the first developer of the platform.  
My main role was to create a distributed ecosystem of micro services for our Mapping Platform. Storage API (GIS allowing to manipulate and manage datasets), Tile-edge (a highly efficient Map Server), Static Maps API, authentication system, and the administration section.

description.label: Management of Clustering / Data Processors / Geo-Caching
description.details:
In order to be highly efficient, GIS need to implement specific features such as multi-threaded Geocaching, Meta-Tile awareness, Server-side clustering, and multi-layer clustering.  
Also, managing datasets with tens of thousands of geometries often requires to import heterogeneous Data from different providers. I was in charge to create the API for a Data Import Processing SDK targeting on-premises versions of the platform for some of our customers. This allowed to handle tricky cases such as transaction rollback, data deduplication (both semantical and geographical), and conflict resolution.

description.label: Geospatial data consultant
description.details: After working with geo-spatial data management for a few years, our team is now helping several companies by sharing its expertise to help companies build awesome services with their own geo-localized assets.

description.label: DevOps consultant
description.details: By doing many load-testing campains and working hard on automation, I have been working with several partners to help share the word about DevOps practices. I also advocate in different tech conferences and meetups such as Devoxx, Modern DevOps, and so on.

company.name: Takima
company.description: Raising Coding ninjas in DevOps, Java, Web and Mobile technologies

description.label: Development of an ecosystem of Android apps for festivals and conferences
description.details: Creation of a new offer around festivals and conference centers to add live data and geo-spatial information, Augmented reality and social features. It also embedded city-wide gaming capabilities and served as an experiment in the Transmusicales festival in 2014.

description.label: Development of a Java/JS/Android/iOS SDK for DesignMyApp
description.details: DesignMyApp is a native mobile-app generator and one of the first single-node container orchestrators. I designed the core engine, and common/SDK open source libraries. Check it out on Github: https://github.com/e-biz/designmyapp .

description.label: Development of a conference driving mobile application (Android >= 4.0)
description.details:
This project had two challenges:
 * How can we use the tablets/phones's ergonomy to our advantage to make a conference more dynamic for students?
 * What tools can we give the showman/teacher so he could get closer to his audience, communicate further with them, push multimedia contents to the clients and get live feedback from them?

description.label: Adaptation of an open data database model (GTFS) for train schedules to be used on an embedded SQLite database
description.details:
The concept was to reverse-engineer the time-based info into a predictive frequency model.
In the end, the embedded database is about 1/290 of the original size.

description.label: Advocating
description.details: I started giving trainings and conferences about Java, Java EE, Android, and Git to mostly universities.

company.name: DP Technology
company.description: World leader in CAM software for industry. Most famous product: ESPRIT

description.label: Development of ASP modules for EspritWeb
description.details: I started my 1-year internship in Camarillo California (Los angeles area) in July 2011. I was in charge of developing two new modules for the EspritWeb platform. One Remote file sharing system, called **Cloud Drive**, and a set of **IT Administration tools** for the IT department. Technologies involved were ASP.NET and Microsoft SQL.

description.label: Management of the Backup system renewal
description.details: The company backups were manual backups made on tapes or ghost DvDs. I lead the company backup system renewal, from scratch (quotes, design, test, setup) using Hyper-V snapshots, full & diff backups, tape drives and NAS servers. It also involved Powershell scripting for cron scheduling and reporting after every nightly backup.

description.label: Network/System administration of the IT infrastructure/datacenter
description.details: I was handling system and network administration issues, to deliver high availability for both front and back office applications (Web servers, File servers, IP phones) using Microsoft Hyper-V based virtual servers
